Good Afternoon Cardinal Families,

In response to the recent school closure announcement, and the State of Public Health Disaster Emergency issued by Gov. Reynolds, we have received questions from families and teachers about providing instruction and learning opportunities for students while schools are closed. First and foremost we want our students, families and staff to be safe. At this time, during our scheduled spring break, please take care of yourselves and families.

We will continue to seek guidance from the Iowa Department of Education and collaborate with other school districts to determine how to best meet the educational needs of our students. At this time, please continue to treat this closure as a regularly scheduled break with regard to supporting your student(s) learning needs. We will send out information about more formalized plans in the near future.

Students picked up about 400 bags of trash around the community, painted a mural by Bridgehouse Coffee Shop, planted flowers around the downtown square, touched up the wall murals at Manatt's, put up murals under the Sunset Park underpass (in progress), planted five trees downtown, and washed windows at Mercy One!

THANK YOU to the 2019 Red Pride Service Day Sponsors!
